title: The BCI Tribunal
outcome: The Council calls a public tribunal to decide the BCI's fate, but it is rigged by manipulating citizen access and scoring. Rada exposes the deception, sparking walkouts by engineers and a broadcast blackout. Mid-level staff refuse to carry out orders as trust collapses, leading to a standoff between Council and citizens.

events.description: The Council launches a highly publicized tribunal, selecting random citizens for input on the BCI's future. Only those with favorable scores are actually granted voice.
Rada exposes proof that citizen participation in the tribunal is manipulated, with scores rigged live to suppress dissenting voices. Outrage spreads.
Groups of engineers and mid-level staff walk out, refusing to maintain the BCI system as ethical protest. Services begin to falter. Broadcasts are blacked out to stem unrest.
Street demonstrations swell as the tribunal collapses into chaos. For the first time, segments of the public sector openly defy Council orders, deepening the political crisis.
